benchmark_details.name: Mathematical Entities: Corpora and Benchmarks
benchmark_details.overview: This paper provides annotated corpora that can be used to study the language of mathematics in different contexts, ranging from fundamental concepts in textbooks to advanced research mathematics, including models for terminology extraction, definition extraction, and entity linking.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a collection of mathematical language corpora that provide insight and benchmarking for computational linguistics research on mathematics.

data.source: Three initial mathematical corpora covering different contexts in the field of category theory.
data.annotation: Annotations of dependency trees, part of speech tags, generated automatically using spaCy.

methods: Evaluation of terminology extraction, definition extraction, and entity linking models.
methodology.calculation: Metrics calculated based on the performance of models against extracted benchmarks.
methodology.interpretation: Higher precision indicates fewer irrelevant terms predicted, while higher recall indicates better coverage of true terms.
methodology.validation: Evaluation involves various models tested against benchmarks derived from the corpora.
